title: Markdown edit mode - text visually overwrites lines above with bigger headings enabled
body:

### Description

In markdown files there are certain conditions where text is moved up seemingly overwriting previous lines in the editor view when text is entered and bigger headings are enabled.

For easier understanding I created two screen recordings showing the different behavior with bigger headings enabled & disabled:

**bigger headings enabled**

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/97251923/211094706-ca80f2c3-b05b-471f-b740-cff04fb69efa.mp4

**bigger headings disabled**

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/97251923/211094799-1d674528-fb2f-43c8-9c81-382c29ad8cfc.mp4

**Expected behavior**
Existing lines should not be overwritten when entering text.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Enable bigger headings in the settings.
2. Create a new empty markdown file.
3. Paste the following text into the file:
```
Test123
abc

----
Test
----
```
4. Move the cursor behind "Test", press enter (newline) and enter some characters.
5. The text is moved up seemingly overwriting the content of the lines above.
6. Go back into the file overview and then reopen the markdown file.
7. The previously overwritten lines are visible again.


### Information

Android version: 13
Device: Google Pixel 6a
Markor App Version: 2.10.6
Mordor App Version: 2.10.16-1700 (version code 221229)

F-Droid
